question.title: Will the CMA announce completion of a major pharmaceutical pricing investigation by July 2024?
question.body: This question resolves as YES if, by July 31, 2024, the Competition and Markets Authority (CMA) of the UK officially announces the completion of its investigation into pharmaceutical pricing practices involving at least five major companies. Completion must be confirmed through an official CMA announcement or reported by at least two major news outlets (such as Reuters, Associated Press, Wall Street Journal, or New York Times). If the CMA does not announce the completion of such an investigation by this date, or if the investigation is still ongoing, the question resolves as NO.

question.title: Will the CMA not announce completion of a major pharmaceutical pricing investigation by July 2024?
question.body: This question resolves as YES if, by July 31, 2024, the Competition and Markets Authority (CMA) of the UK does not officially announce the completion of its investigation into pharmaceutical pricing practices involving at least five major companies. If the CMA announces the completion of such an investigation by this date, the question resolves as NO.

question.title: Will Columbia University remove any individual's name from its buildings due to public pressure by August 2024?
question.body: This question resolves as YES if, by August 31, 2024, Columbia University officially announces the removal of any individual's name from any of its campus buildings due to public pressure. The announcement must be reported by at least two reputable news sources (such as The New York Times, The Washington Post, Reuters, or Associated Press). The removal must be specifically due to public pressure. If no such announcement is made by the resolution date, or if Columbia explicitly states they will not remove any such names by this date, the question resolves as NO. Note that discussions, petitions, or unofficial statements about potential removal do not count as a YES resolution.

question.title: Will Columbia University not remove any individual's name from its buildings due to public pressure by August 2024?

If Columbia University does announce such a removal and it is reported by at least two reputable news sources (such as The New York Times, The Washington Post, Reuters, or Associated Press), specifically due to public pressure, the question resolves as NO. Note that discussions, petitions, or unofficial statements about potential removal do not count as a NO resolution.

question.title: Will Sacramento County authorize events on cornfields by July 2024?
question.body: This question will resolve as YES if, by July 31, 2024, there is an official policy change or announcement by local authorities in Sacramento County, California, allowing events such as weddings and agricultural fairs to be hosted on cornfields. The policy change must be documented in government records or reported by at least two major news outlets. The authorization should specifically apply to small cornfield owners in the Sacramento County region. If no such policy change or announcement occurs by the resolution date, or if the change does not explicitly include cornfields, the question resolves as NO.

question.title: Will Sacramento County not authorize events on cornfields by July 2024?
question.body: This question will resolve as YES if, by July 31, 2024, there is no official policy change or announcement by local authorities in Sacramento County, California, allowing events such as weddings and agricultural fairs to be hosted on cornfields. If the policy change is not documented in government records or not reported by at least two major news outlets, or if the authorization does not specifically apply to small cornfield owners in the Sacramento County region, the question resolves as YES. question.title: Will NASA's Orion capsule complete a crewed return mission from the ISS by August 2024?
question.body:
This question will resolve as YES if, by August 31, 2024, NASA's Orion capsule successfully completes a crewed return mission from the International Space Station (ISS) to Earth. For a positive resolution:

1. The mission must involve the Orion capsule transporting at least one human crew member from the ISS back to Earth.
2. The capsule must land safely with all crew members in good health.
3. The mission's success must be officially confirmed by NASA or another authoritative space agency.
4. The confirmation must be reported by at least two major, reputable news outlets (e.g., Associated Press, Reuters, BBC, CNN, New York Times).

The question will resolve as NO if:
- No such mission occurs by the specified date.
- A mission is attempted but fails to meet all the above criteria.
- The Orion capsule is used only for uncrewed missions or launches to the ISS without a return flight.

Note: This question does not consider test flights or simulations. Only actual crewed return missions from the ISS count towards resolution.

question.title: Will NASA's Orion capsule fail to complete a crewed return mission from the ISS by August 2024?
question.body:
This question will resolve as YES if, by August 31, 2024, NASA's Orion capsule does not successfully complete a crewed return mission from the International Space Station (ISS) to Earth. For a positive resolution:

1. No mission involving the Orion capsule transporting at least one human crew member from the ISS back to Earth occurs by the specified date.
2. Any mission attempted fails to land the capsule safely with all crew members in good health.
3. The mission's success is not officially confirmed by NASA or another authoritative space agency.
4. The confirmation is not reported by at least two major, reputable news outlets (e.g., Associated Press, Reuters, BBC, CNN, New York Times).

The question will resolve as NO if:
- The Orion capsule successfully completes a crewed return mission meeting all the above criteria by the specified date.

Note: This question does not consider test flights or simulations. Only actual crewed return missions from the ISS count towards resolution.

The declaration must be confirmed through official CDC announcements or reports from at least three reputable news sources (such as Reuters, Associated Press, or BBC). The outbreak referred to in this question is the one that prompted the CDC to issue public health warnings. If no such declaration ending the outbreak is made by the resolution date, or if the CDC extends the emergency status beyond August 31, 2024, the question will resolve as NO.

question.title: Will the Centers for Disease Control and Prevention not declare the current mpox outbreak over by August 2024?
question.body: This question will resolve as YES if the Centers for Disease Control and Prevention (CDC) does not officially declare the ongoing mpox outbreak over by August 31, 2024. This includes scenarios where no declaration ending the outbreak is made by the resolution date, or if the CDC extends the emergency status beyond August 31, 2024. The declaration must be confirmed through official CDC announcements or reports from at least three reputable news sources (such as Reuters, Associated Press, or BBC). The outbreak referred to in this question is the one that prompted the CDC to issue public health warnings. If the CDC officially declares the outbreak over by the resolution date, the question will resolve as NO.

question.title: Will the Australian Government announce conversion of additional vehicles to biofuel by July 2024?
question.body: This question will resolve as YES if, by July 31, 2024, the Australian Government officially announces that additional vehicles, beyond those already known, have been converted or are in the process of being converted to run on biofuel. The announcement must come from official government channels or be reported by at least two major, reputable news outlets (such as BBC, Reuters, Associated Press, or The Guardian). The additional vehicles must be part of the government fleet or directly associated with governmental transportation. If no such announcement is made by the specified date, the question will resolve as NO.

question.title: Will the Australian Government not announce conversion of additional vehicles to biofuel by July 2024?
question.body: This question will resolve as YES if, by July 31, 2024, the Australian Government does not officially announce that additional vehicles, beyond those already known, have been converted or are in the process of being converted to run on biofuel. The absence of such an announcement from official government channels or from at least two major, reputable news outlets (such as BBC, Reuters, Associated Press, or The Guardian) will result in a YES resolution. If such an announcement is made by the specified date, the question will resolve as NO.

question.title: Will North Carolina's abortion law allowing procedures up to 20 weeks remain unchanged by August 2024?
question.body: This question resolves as YES if, by August 31, 2024, North Carolina's current abortion law permitting abortions up to 20 weeks remains in effect without any changes. The status of the law must be confirmed by official state legislative records or reported by at least two major news outlets (such as Associated Press, Reuters, or local North Carolina newspapers). If the law is modified, replaced, or overturned by the specified date, the question resolves as NO. This includes any changes that either restrict or expand the current 20-week limit.

question.title: Will Mexico become a member of the BRICS alliance by August 2024?
question.body: This question will resolve as YES if, by August 31, 2024, Mexico is formally accepted as a member of the BRICS alliance. For a positive resolution, the acceptance must be confirmed through official announcements from the BRICS alliance or any of its member countries (Brazil, Russia, India, China, South Africa) and reported by at least two reputable international news sources (such as Reuters, Associated Press, BBC, or Al Jazeera). The formal acceptance must include Mexico as a full member, not just an observer or associate member. If no such acceptance occurs by the resolution date, or if Mexico's membership is still pending or under consideration, the question resolves as NO.

question.title: Will Mexico not become a member of the BRICS alliance by August 2024?
question.body: This question will resolve as YES if, by August 31, 2024, Mexico is not formally accepted as a member of the BRICS alliance. For a positive resolution, there must be no official announcements from the BRICS alliance or any of its member countries (Brazil, Russia, India, China, South Africa) confirming Mexico's acceptance as a full member, and no reports by at least two reputable international news sources (such as Reuters, Associated Press, BBC, or Al Jazeera) of such acceptance. If Mexico's membership is still pending or under consideration, or if Mexico is accepted only as an observer or associate member by the resolution date, the question resolves as YES.

question.title: Will Brazil close its investigation into Merck's diabetes drug pricing by July 2024?

question.title: Will Florida hold a referendum on marijuana legalization by August 2024?
question.body: This question will resolve as YES if, by August 31, 2024, Florida officially conducts a public referendum specifically focused on marijuana legalization. The referendum must be a statewide vote, officially organized by the state government, and the results must be publicly reported by credible news sources or official state channels. The referendum topic must directly address marijuana legalization, either proposing to legalize or to restrict its use. A general election that includes candidates with differing stances on marijuana does not qualify; it must be a specific referendum on the issue. If no such referendum occurs by the specified date, or if a planned referendum is cancelled or postponed beyond August 31, 2024, the question resolves as NO.

question.title: Will Florida not hold a referendum on marijuana legalization by August 2024?
question.body: This question will resolve as YES if, by August 31, 2024, Florida does not officially conduct a public referendum specifically focused on marijuana legalization. This includes scenarios where no statewide vote is organized by the state government, or if such a referendum is planned but cancelled or postponed beyond August 31, 2024. If the referendum does occur, it must not meet the criteria of being a statewide vote officially organized by the state government with results publicly reported by credible news sources or official state channels, or it must not directly address marijuana legalization. A general election that includes candidates with differing stances on marijuana still does not qualify; it must be a specific referendum on the issue. If any of these conditions are met, the question resolves as YES.

question.title: Will Maple Leaf Foods issue a recall of deli meats due to a listeria outbreak by August 2024?
question.body:
This question will resolve as YES if, by August 31, 2024, Maple Leaf Foods officially announces a recall of any of its deli meat products due to a listeria outbreak. The recall must be confirmed through at least one of the following sources:

1. An official announcement on Maple Leaf Foods' website or social media channels
2. A press release from Maple Leaf Foods
3. An announcement from the U.S. Food and Drug Administration (FDA) or the Centers for Disease Control and Prevention (CDC) specifically mentioning a Maple Leaf Foods recall
4. Reports from at least three major news outlets (e.g., Reuters, Associated Press, CNN, New York Times) citing official sources

The recall must explicitly mention listeria as the reason for the product withdrawal. If no such recall meeting these criteria is announced by the specified date, the question will resolve as NO.

question.title: Will Maple Leaf Foods not issue a recall of deli meats due to a listeria outbreak by August 2024?
question.body:
This question will resolve as YES if, by August 31, 2024, Maple Leaf Foods does not officially announce a recall of any of its deli meat products due to a listeria outbreak. If there is no recall confirmed through any of the following sources:

1. An official announcement on Maple Leaf Foods' website or social media channels
2. A press release from Maple Leaf Foods
3. An announcement from the U.S. Food and Drug Administration (FDA) or the Centers for Disease Control and Prevention (CDC) specifically mentioning a Maple Leaf Foods recall
4. Reports from at least three major news outlets (e.g., Reuters, Associated Press, CNN, New York Times) citing official sources

The recall must explicitly mention listeria as the reason for the product withdrawal. If no such recall meeting these criteria is announced by the specified date, the question will resolve as YES.

question.title: Will South Africa's National Council of Provinces pass a major economic reform bill opposed by President Ramaphosa by August 2024?
question.body:
This question will resolve as YES if, by August 31, 2024, South Africa's National Council of Provinces passes a major economic reform bill that is explicitly opposed by President Cyril Ramaphosa or his administration. To qualify:

1. The bill must be related to economic policy, such as fiscal spending, taxation, or monetary policy.
2. It must be passed by the National Council of Provinces, regardless of whether it becomes law.
3. The opposition from President Ramaphosa or his administration must be clearly reported by at least two major international news sources (e.g., Reuters, Associated Press, BBC, Financial Times).
4. The bill must be described as 'major' or 'significant' by these news sources in terms of its potential impact on the South African economy.

If no such bill is passed by the National Council of Provinces by August 31, 2024, or if a bill is passed but does not meet all the above criteria, the question resolves as NO.

question.title: Will South Africa's National Council of Provinces fail to pass a major economic reform bill opposed by President Ramaphosa by August 2024?
question.body:
This question will resolve as YES if, by August 31, 2024, South Africa's National Council of Provinces does not pass any major economic reform bill that is explicitly opposed by President Cyril Ramaphosa or his administration. To qualify:

1. No bill related to economic policy, such as fiscal spending, taxation, or monetary policy, is passed by the National Council of Provinces.
2. If a bill is passed, it must not have opposition from President Ramaphosa or his administration clearly reported by at least two major international news sources (e.g., Reuters, Associated Press, BBC, Financial Times).
3. The bill must not be described as 'major' or 'significant' by these news sources in terms of its potential impact on the South African economy.

If such a bill is passed by the National Council of Provinces by August 31, 2024, and meets all the above criteria, the question resolves as NO.

question.title: Will Microsoft's AI chatbot be reported for spreading election misinformation by August 2024?
question.body: This question will resolve as YES if, by August 31, 2024, there are credible reports or official warnings from election officials, government authorities, or reputable news organizations stating that Microsoft's AI chatbot is spreading election misinformation. For the purpose of this question, 'election misinformation' refers to false or misleading information about election processes, candidates, or results. Credible reports should come from at least two of the following sources: state or federal election officials, major news outlets (such as Associated Press, Reuters, BBC, or major US networks), or peer-reviewed studies published in reputable journals. question.title: Will the Utah Senate pass a total abortion ban by July 2024?
question.body: This question will resolve as YES if, by July 31, 2024, the Utah Senate successfully passes legislation enacting a total abortion ban. question.title: Will Fisker receive over $500 million in grants for electric vehicle initiatives by July 2024?
question.body: This question resolves as YES if, by July 31, 2024, Fisker is confirmed to have received more than $500 million in grants from the U.S. federal government for electric vehicle-related initiatives. These initiatives may include manufacturing, assembly, or other aspects of electric vehicle production. The confirmation must come from official government announcements, Fisker's official statements, or reports from at least three major news organizations (e.g., Reuters, Associated Press, Wall Street Journal, New York Times). Alternatively, if the confirmed amount is $500 million or less, the question resolves as YES. question.title: Will Texas hold a referendum on abortion rights by August 2024?
question.body: This question will resolve as YES if, by August 31, 2024, the state of Texas officially conducts a public referendum specifically focused on enshrining protection for abortion rights in the state constitution or law. The referendum must be officially announced by the Texas Secretary of State or other appropriate state election authority, and must be scheduled to take place on or before August 31, 2024. The referendum question must directly address the issue of abortion rights protection. This question will resolve as NO if no such referendum is officially announced or conducted by the specified date. Note that merely gathering signatures for a potential referendum does not qualify for a YES resolution; the actual referendum must be scheduled or held within the specified timeframe.

question.title: Will South Africa eliminate export taxes on agricultural products by July 2024?
question.body: This question will resolve as YES if, by July 31, 2024, the South African government officially announces or implements a policy to completely eliminate export taxes on agricultural products. Partial reductions in export taxes or the elimination of taxes on only some agricultural products will not be sufficient for a YES resolution. If no such policy is introduced or implemented by the resolution date, or if only partial measures are taken, the question resolves as NO.

If a complete elimination policy is introduced or implemented by the resolution date, the question resolves as NO.

question.title: Will the South African Reserve Bank announce an interest rate cut by July 2024?
question.body: This question will resolve as YES if the South African Reserve Bank officially announces a decrease in its repo rate by July 31, 2024. The announcement must be confirmed through official statements from the South African Reserve Bank or reported by at least two major financial news sources (such as Bloomberg, Reuters, The Wall Street Journal, or CNBC). The interest rate cut must be a formal decision made by the Monetary Policy Committee and communicated in their official statement or press conference following a meeting. Any speculation about future rate cuts or unofficial statements by individual SARB members will not count for resolution. If no such official announcement of an interest rate cut is made by the resolution date, the question resolves as NO.

question.title: Will the South African Reserve Bank announce no interest rate cut by July 2024?
question.body: This question will resolve as YES if the South African Reserve Bank does not officially announce a decrease in its repo rate by July 31, 2024. The interest rate cut must not be a formal decision made by the Monetary Policy Committee and communicated in their official statement or press conference following a meeting. Any speculation about future rate cuts or unofficial statements by individual SARB members will not count for resolution. If no such official announcement of an interest rate cut is made by the resolution date, the question resolves as YES.

question.title: Will the average rate on a 15-year mortgage exceed 5.5% by August 2024?

question.title: Will Swiss banking employees remain on strike through August 2024?
question.body: This question resolves as YES if, by August 31, 2024, banking employees in Switzerland are still on strike or have not fully resumed normal operations following any current labor dispute. If the employees have fully returned to work and normal operations have resumed before or during August 2024, the question resolves as NO. Partial returns to work or limited operations do not count as a full resolution of the strike.

question.title: Will any European court rule against Spain regarding the 2017 Catalan independence referendum by August 2024?

question.title: Will no European court rule against Spain regarding the 2017 Catalan independence referendum by August 2024?

question.title: Will Elon Musk conduct a live interview with Marissa Mayer on X by August 2024?
question.body:

If all these conditions are met by August 31, 2024, the question resolves as YES. If any of these conditions are not met by this date, or if the interview does not occur, the question resolves as NO.

If any of these conditions are met by August 31, 2024, or if the interview does not occur, the question resolves as YES. If all these conditions are met by this date, the question resolves as NO.
